speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in the castle.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I like him not, nor stands it safe with us

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To let his madness range. Therefore prepare you;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I your commission will forthwith dispatch,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And he to England shall along with you:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The terms of our estate may not endure

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Hazard so dangerous as doth hourly grow

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Out of his lunacies.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: We will ourselves provide:

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Most holy and religious fear it is

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: To keep those many many bodies safe

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: That live and feed upon your majesty.

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: The single and peculiar life is bound,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: With all the strength and armour of the mind,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: To keep itself from noyance; but much more

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: That spirit upon whose weal depend and rest

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: The lives of many. The cease of majesty

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Dies not alone; but, like a gulf, doth draw

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: What's near it with it: it is a massy wheel,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Fix'd on the summit of the highest mount,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: To whose huge spokes ten thousand lesser things

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Are mortised and adjoin'd; which, when it falls,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Each small annexment, petty consequence,

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Attends the boisterous ruin. Never alone

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Did the king sigh, but with a general groan.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Arm you, I pray you, to this speedy voyage;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: For we will fetters put upon this fear,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Which now goes too free-footed.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: We will haste us.

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Exeunt ROSENCRANTZ and GUILDENSTERN

speaker: GUILDENSTERN
text_entry: Enter POLONIUS

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: My lord, he's going to his mother's closet:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Behind the arras I'll convey myself,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: To hear the process; and warrant she'll tax him home:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And, as you said, and wisely was it said,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: 'Tis meet that some more audience than a mother,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Since nature makes them partial, should o'erhear

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: The speech, of vantage. Fare you well, my liege:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: I'll call upon you ere you go to bed,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And tell you what I know.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Thanks, dear my lord.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exit POLONIUS

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O, my offence is rank it smells to heaven;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: It hath the primal eldest curse upon't,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: A brother's murder. Pray can I not,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Though inclination be as sharp as will:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My stronger guilt defeats my strong intent;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And, like a man to double business bound,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I stand in pause where I shall first begin,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And both neglect. What if this cursed hand

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Were thicker than itself with brother's blood,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Is there not rain enough in the sweet heavens

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To wash it white as snow? Whereto serves mercy

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But to confront the visage of offence?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And what's in prayer but this two-fold force,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To be forestalled ere we come to fall,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or pardon'd being down? Then I'll look up;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My fault is past. But, O, what form of prayer

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Can serve my turn? 'Forgive me my foul murder'?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: That cannot be; since I am still possess'd

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Of those effects for which I did the murder,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: My crown, mine own ambition and my queen.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: May one be pardon'd and retain the offence?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In the corrupted currents of this world

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Offence's gilded hand may shove by justice,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And oft 'tis seen the wicked prize itself

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Buys out the law: but 'tis not so above;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: There is no shuffling, there the action lies

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In his true nature; and we ourselves compell'd,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Even to the teeth and forehead of our faults,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: To give in evidence. What then? what rests?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Try what repentance can: what can it not?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Yet what can it when one can not repent?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O wretched state! O bosom black as death!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O limed soul, that, struggling to be free,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Art more engaged! Help, angels! Make assay!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Bow, stubborn knees; and, heart with strings of steel,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Be soft as sinews of the newborn babe!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: All may be well.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Retires and kneels

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Now might I do it pat, now he is praying;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And now I'll do't. And so he goes to heaven;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And so am I revenged. That would be scann'd:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A villain kills my father; and for that,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I, his sole son, do this same villain send

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To heaven.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, this is hire and salary, not revenge.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He took my father grossly, full of bread;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With all his crimes broad blown, as flush as May;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And how his audit stands who knows save heaven?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But in our circumstance and course of thought,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: 'Tis heavy with him: and am I then revenged,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To take him in the purging of his soul,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When he is fit and season'd for his passage?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Up, sword; and know thou a more horrid hent:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When he is drunk asleep, or in his rage,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or in the incestuous pleasure of his bed;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: At gaming, swearing, or about some act

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That has no relish of salvation in't;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Then trip him, that his heels may kick at heaven,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And that his soul may be as damn'd and black

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As hell, whereto it goes. My mother stays:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This physic but prolongs thy sickly days.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: [Rising]  My words fly up, my thoughts remain below:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Words without thoughts never to heaven go.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Exit
